ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cisplatin and Radiation-Induced Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of concurrent cisplatin chemotherapy and cranial radiation for nasopharyngeal cancer, followed by progressive sensorineural hearing loss.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic Otitis Media with Effusion
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Persistent Eustachian tube dysfunction and fluid buildup due to radiation effects, evidenced by conductive components and history of PE tubes.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Monitor progression of hearing thresholds post-treatment.
Assess functional communication ability and speech recognition deterioration.
Evaluate middle ear status given history of chronic otitis media and PE tubes.
Assess integrity of the reflex arc and middle ear function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial exam 2 months post-treatment reveals bilateral mild sloping to moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss with a conductive component in the left ear. Speech recognition is fair to good, but acoustic reflexes are absent.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetric mild sloping to moderate SNHL through 750 Hz, sloping to moderately severe SNHL at 1000-8000 Hz. Left ear air-bone gap at 250-500 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 50 dB HL bilaterally. WRS Right 78%, Left 92%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear flat with large volume (patent PE tube); Left ear hypocompliant with negative pressure.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Five years post-diagnosis, testing shows a significant progression of hearing loss in the high frequencies (3000 Hz and above) for both air and bone conduction, confirming ototoxic/radiation effects beyond the initial loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Significant decrease in thresholds at 3000 Hz and above compared to baseline. BC thresholds at 2000-4000 Hz dropped.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 50 dB HL bilaterally. WRS Right 78%, Left 82%.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Ten years post-initial exam, hearing has deteriorated to severe-to-profound mixed loss with very poor speech recognition, necessitating reliance on visual cues and assistive technology.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right severe to profound mixed loss; Left profound mixed loss. No measurable response at 4000-8000 Hz bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT Right 88 dB HL, Left 100 dB HL. WRS Right 36%, Left 20%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Could not be completed due to inability to maintain an appropriate seal (CNT).

proposed_items: Use of personal infrared hearing assistive technology (HAT) for television
Cochlear Implant (CI) evaluation (performed, patient declined surgery)
Continued otolaryngology follow-up for chronic otitis media
counseling_actions: Educate on the combined progressive effects of cisplatin and radiation on hearing
Discuss realistic expectations for amplification given poor speech recognition scores
Advise on communication strategies such as using visual cues
Counsel on the potential benefits of FM technology for signal-to-noise ratio improvement

escalation.rationale_short: Ongoing management of chronic serous otitis media and persistent conductive component.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds and middle ear status; adjust amplification and assistive devices as needed.

expected_outcome: Continues follow-up visits with his otologist regarding the persistent conductive component.
Annual evaluations have revealed no recurrence of the nasopharyngeal cancer.
Patient decided against pursuing the CI due to his health and concerns regarding anesthesia.
Continues using his hearing aids while considering a personal FM system.
